events.message: The insured reported a car collision that occurred on February 28th, involving rear-end damage to their vehicle at a traffic light.
Claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident due to damage sustained during the collision with another vehicle.
An experienced claims agent was assigned to handle the auto accident claim to ensure prompt processing and support.
The insured received acknowledgement of their claim submission along with outlined next steps for documentation and investigation.
Request sent for copies of the police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and repair estimates to proceed with the claim.
The insured has submitted the police report, photos of the damaged rear bumper, and a repair quotation from an authorized garage.
Claims investigation has commenced to verify the details of the auto accident and assess the extent of the vehicle damage.
Investigation findings confirm the insured was not at fault, and the damage assessment aligns with submitted repair cost estimates.
A settlement offer has been proposed covering full repair costs and associated fees, subject to insuredâ€™s approval.
The insured has expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and prompt handling of their auto accident claim.
The claim has been formally approved, confirming coverage and authorizing the release of the settlement amount to the insured.
Payment for the approved settlement amount was issued to the insured's account to cover vehicle repairs.
The auto accident claim has been formally closed following confirmation of vehicle repairs and receipt of payment.
All case files and correspondence related to the claim have been archived in accordance with company policies.
